page.title: 03Thame Market
page.content: Thame market was originally a medieval cattle market and has been held here since 1227.(see Trade) It is situated in the High Street which is the second widest in the country. It is an open market which is held every Tuesday from 8.00am until 4.00pm and good weather is vital for sales. There are 53 stalls, the main ones selling food and clothes. The market traders are responsible for the stalls in the market and as the rent is so low there is fierce competition to trade there. The people who shop at the market are mostly elderly who enjoy the friendly atmosphere and bargaining. The market is also popular with young mothers who bring their children to help them get their weekly stores. The market provides the town with much of its character.
